These little plants are known for their nettlesome attitude. Their personalities mirror the spines that sprout from all over their bodies, making them cantankerous and slightly prickly, though they are unswervingly loyal to those who earn their trust. At home in dry and arid landscapes, cactus leshys store water inside their bodies in order to survive these harsh conditions. Cactus leshys come in all different shapes and colors: tall and thin, with beautiful, vibrantly colored blooms on their heads; squat and rotund, with rows and rows of orderly spines; or seemingly haphazard, with flat segments stacked end to end as if they were balancing on one another. **[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 16 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 11 [Cactus Leshy](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1219) **Source** [Bestiary 3](/Sources.aspx?ID=66) pg. 160 **Perception** +9; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=23) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Druidic](/Languages.aspx?ID=23), [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10); [_speak with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=294) (succulents only) **Skills** [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +7, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +6, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +7 **Str** +3 **Dex** +2 **Con** +4 **Int** -1 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +0 **Little Oasis** If a cactus leshy is willing, a creature can harvest enough water from the leshy's inner cavity to fill a single [waterskin](/Equipment.aspx?ID=62) without harming them. Doing so again before the leshy can replenish the water causes the leshy to immediately suffer from [dehydration](/Rules.aspx?ID=537). --- **AC** 18 **Fort** +10 **Ref** +6 **Will** +7 **HP** 30 **Spiny Body** A cactus leshy is covered in spines. A creature that [Grabs](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) the cactus leshy takes 1d8+3 piercing damage.
**Verdant Burst** When a cactus leshy dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from its body, restoring 2d8 Hit Points to each [plant](/Traits.aspx?ID=125) creature in a 30-foot emanation. This area fills with cacti, becoming difficult terrain. If the terrain is not a viable environment for the cacti, they wither after 24 hours. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** spine +11, **Damage** 1d8+3 piercing **Ranged** spine +11 ([range increment 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 1d8+3 piercing **Primal Innate Spells** DC 18 - **4th** [Speak with Plants](/Spells.aspx?ID=294) **[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=8)** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) The cactus leshy transforms into a Small cactus. This ability otherwise uses the effects of [_tree shape_](/Spells.aspx?ID=342). **Prickly Burst** **Frequency** once per day; **Effect** The cactus leshy shoots their spines in every direction. All creatures in a 10-foot emanation take 3d6 piercing damage (DC 18 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save).
Water Storage Due to their internal cavities, cactus leshys can give water to surrounding creatures in times of need. They can give up to half of their water reserves without perishing. They might choose to sacrifice their water to help nearby plants that are parched or to save a comrade who is dying of thirst. Extracting water from a cactus leshy is not an exact science, so one must take care not to let the water slosh out of the leshy, lest it die from dehydration.
